body.p: Asynchronous events are used to notify host software of error and health information as these events occur. To enable asynchronous events to be reported by the controller, host software needs to issue one or more Asynchronous Event Request commands to the controller. The controller indicates an event to the host by completing an Asynchronous Event Request command. Host software should expect that the controller may not execute the command immediately; the command is completed when there is an event to be posted.
Asynchronous Event Requests are queued in by the Admin Command Manager until an event causes an Asynchronous Event Completion to be sent to the host.

table.title: Asynchronous Event Request Command Control Flow

entry.p: The command is received by one of the Data Managers.
The Data Manager forwards the command to the Admin Command Manager. The Admin Command Manager may queue up to Asynchronous Event Request Limit (AERL) + 1 requests.
